Regroup 'incidence' objects

Source: R/regroup.R
regroup.Rd

This function regroups an incidence() object across the specified groups. The resulting incidence() object will contains counts summed over the groups present in the input.

regroup(x, groups = NULL)

Arguments

x

An incidence() object.
groups

The groups to sum over. If NULL (default) then the function ignores all groups.

Author

Thibaut Jombart thibautjombart@gmail.com

Examples

if (requireNamespace("outbreaks", quietly = TRUE)) {
  withAutoprint({
    data(ebola_sim_clean, package = "outbreaks")
    dat <- ebola_sim_clean$linelist
    i <- incidence(dat,
                   date_index = date_of_onset,
                   groups = c(gender, hospital))

    i %>% regroup()

    i %>% regroup(hospital)
  })
}

#> > data(ebola_sim_clean, package = "outbreaks")
#> > dat <- ebola_sim_clean$linelist
#> > i <- incidence(dat, date_index = date_of_onset, groups = c(gender, hospital))
#> > i %>% regroup()

#>  2 2014-04-08     0
#>  3 2014-04-09     0
#>  4 2014-04-10     0
#>  5 2014-04-11     0
#>  6 2014-04-12     0
#>  7 2014-04-13     0
#>  8 2014-04-14     0
#>  9 2014-04-15     1
#> 10 2014-04-16     0
#> # … with 379 more rows
#> 
#> > i %>% regroup(hospital)
#> An incidence2 object: 2,334 x 3
#> [5829 cases from days 2014-04-07 to 2015-04-30]

#> [cumulative: FALSE]
#>

#>  2 2014-04-07 Military Hospital                                1

#>  4 2014-04-07 Princess Christian Maternity Hospital (PCMH)     0

#>  7 2014-04-08 Connaught Hospital                               0
#>  8 2014-04-08 Military Hospital                                0
#>  9 2014-04-08 other                                            0

#> # … with 2,324 more rows
